The patient expressed that her desire to "let go" and be at peace. She is tired of "fighting" her end stage liver disease and does not feel that she has a good quality of life. She wished to meet with a representative from hospice, which we were able to arrange, and she decided that she would like to go home with hospice. A conversation was held with the patient regarding code status. She noted that she would probably be DNR/DNI, but would like to discuss it with her son (HCP). Therefore, at this time, she remains full code. We also discussed the possibility of her getting a pleurex catheter placed because of her repeated paracenteses. She was discharged to home with hospice on . # Decompensated HCV cirrhosis with ascites: The patient presented with worsening ascites. Her pain was initially managed with tramadol and morphine. She underwent paracentesis on with removal of 3.5L and she received albumin. After treatment with calcium gluconate 2gm x2, insulin and D50 x 2, and kayexelate, her K downtrended to 5.4. Her K has been persistently elevated in the past and should continue to be monitored. # Hepatic encephalopathy: The patient's mental status was A+Ox3 on admission.
